headline.seo: Most Children’s Meals at Large Chains Are Unhealthy, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Most Children’s Meals at Large Restaurant Chains Are Still Unhealthy, a Study Finds
headline.main: Most Children’s Meals at Large Restaurant Chains Are Still Unhealthy, a Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study commissioned by Center for Science in the Public Interest finds that 91 percent of meals for children at nation's largest chain restaurants fall short of nutritional standards set by National Restaurant Association's Kids LiveWell program, indicating that little progress has been made since previous study in 2008.
docs.lead_paragraph: A study of the nutritional quality of children’s meals at the nation’s largest chain restaurants showed little improvement in the last four years.
docs.snippet: A study of the nutritional quality of children’s meals at the nation’s largest chain restaurants showed little improvement in the last four years.

keywords.value: Center for Science in the Public Interest
keywords.name: organizations
